title: non_max_suppression is very slow and doesn't appear to have a cuda or multi-threaded implementation
body_html:
It appears that tf.image.non_max_suppression currently takes about 200ms for about 8000 boxes, runs on a single CPU thread and doesn't have a GPU implementation.

Environment info

Operating System:
Ubuntu 16.04

Installed version of CUDA and cuDNN:
(please attach the output of ls -l /path/to/cuda/lib/libcud*):
8.0, 5.1.5

If installed from binary pip package, provide:

  1. A link to the pip package you installed:
  2. The output from python -c "import tensorflow; print(tensorflow.__version__)".
    0.12.0-rc1

body:
It appears that tf.image.non_max_suppression currently takes about 200ms for about 8000 boxes, runs on a single CPU thread and doesn't have a GPU implementation.

### Environment info
Operating System:
Ubuntu 16.04

Installed version of CUDA and cuDNN: 
(please attach the output of `ls -l /path/to/cuda/lib/libcud*`):
8.0, 5.1.5

If installed from binary pip package, provide:

1. A link to the pip package you installed:
2. The output from `python -c "import tensorflow; print(tensorflow.__version__)"`.
0.12.0-rc1
